title: Shooting near synagogue in Germany leaves at least two people dead, police say
text:
Police secures the area after a shooting in the eastern German city of Halle on Oct. 9, 2019. (Stringer/Reuters)

A shooting near a synagogue in the eastern German city of Halle left at least two people dead on Wednesday with one suspect taken into custody, local authorities said.

Police spokeswoman Ulrike Diener said there were also reports of injured people and that multiple suspects were believed to have fled the scene. It was unclear if the shooting was a deliberate attack on Yom Kippur, one of the holiest days of the year in Judaism.

Anti-Semitic hate crimes have risen significantly in recent years in Germany and other European countries.

On Twitter, authorities urged locals to stay in their homes. The train station in the city of 240,000 was also closed as a precaution
